metadata.title: CVE-2022-1664 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
Dpkg::Source::Archive in dpkg, the Debian package management system, beforeversion 1.21.8, 1.20.10, 1.19.8, 1.18.26 is prone to a directory traversalvulnerability. When extracting untrusted source packages in v2 and v3source package formats that include a debian.tar, the in-place extractioncan lead to directory traversal situations on specially crafted orig.tarand debian.tar tarballs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1664` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dpkg - 1.21.9ubuntu1
dselect - 1.21.9ubuntu1
libdpkg-perl - 1.21.9ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dpkg package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.21.9ubuntu1').
